Macros | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions
QSPI
IP

Macros

#define QSPI_CLKSWITCH_MASK   (0xF0000U)
 Mask value to get input clock select value 0 - 128 MHz input clock 1 - 192 MHz input clock 2 - 76.8 MHz input clock.
 
#define QSPI_CLKSWITCH_SHIFT   (16U)
 Shift value to get input clock select value.
 
#define QSPI_CLKDIVIDER_MASK   (0x0FFFFU)
 Mask value to get input clock divider value to be set in QSPI IP internal divider.
 
#define QSPI_CLKDIVIDER_SHIFT   (0U)
 Shift value to get input clock divider value.
 

Typedefs

typedef enum qspiIntrMask qspiIntrMask_t
 This enumerates the flags for word or frame interrupt for QSPI module.
 
typedef enum qspiClkMode qspiClkMode_t
 Enumerates the four possible clock modes for QSPI. Each mode has different values of clock phase(CKPH) and clock polarity(CKP)
 
typedef enum qspiChipSelect qspiChipSelect_t
 Enumerates the different chip selects available to QSPI. QSPI module have four chip selects to connect to four external devices.
 
typedef enum qspiCsPol qspiCsPol_t
 
typedef enum qspiDataDelay qspiDataDelay_t
 Enumerates the value of Data delay value for each chip select. Data is output on the same cycle as CS_N goes active, or 1, 2 or 3 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active depending on the data delay provided.
 
typedef enum qspiMemMapNumAddrBytes qspiMemMapNumAddrBytes_t
 Enumerates the number of Address bytes to be sent before transfer in memory mapped mode for each chip select.
 
typedef enum qspiMemMapPortSel qspiMemMapPortSel_t
 This enumerates the values for switch to be set in the QSPI switch register for selection between config port and memory mapped port. If 0 (default) config port has is selected to control config of core SPI module module. If 1, Memory Mapped Protocol Translator is selected to control config port of core SPI module.
 
typedef enum qspiMemMapReadType qspiMemMapReadType_t
 This enum Enumerates the different read types for each chip select for transfer in memory mapped mode.
 
typedef enum qspiCfgModeTxCmd qspiCfgModeTxCmd_t
 Enumerates the various transfer commands to be set in the command register for transfer using configuration registers.

Detailed Description

Typedef Documentation

typedef enum qspiCsPol qspiCsPol_t

/brief Enumerates the polarities for different chip select available. (Chip Select 0 to Chip Select 3)

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum qspi_ChipSelect_e

Enumerates the values used to represent Chip select value.

Enumerator
QSPI_MMR 

Configuration port registers

QSPI_CS0 

select chip select 0

QSPI_CS1 

select chip select 1

QSPI_CS2 

select chip select 2

QSPI_CS3 

select chip select 3

enum qspi_ClockFreq_e

Enumerates the values used to represent QSPI flash clock frequency.

Enumerator
QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_64MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 64 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_32MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 32 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_16MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 16 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_96MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 96 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_48MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 48 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_24MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 24 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_12MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 12 MHz clock

QSPI_SCLK_FREQ_76_8MHz 

Selects QSPI SCLK Freq as 76.8 MHz clock

enum qspi_DeviceType_e

Enumerates the values used to represent QSPI device type.

Enumerator
DEVICE_TYPE_QSPI4 

4 Bit Quad Fast read at 48 MHz.This is used for flash auto detect

DEVICE_TYPE_QSPI1 

1 Bit Normal read at 12 MHz. This is used for flash auto detect

DEVICE_TYPE_MICRON_QSPI4 

4 bit (Quad) read from Micron Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_MICRON_QSPI1 

1 bit read from Micron Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_MICRON_1GBIT_QSPI4 

4 bit read from 1 GigaBit Micron Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_MICRON_1GBIT_QSPI1 

1 bit read from 1 GigaBit Micron Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_WINBOND_QSPI4 

4 bit (Quad) read from Winbond Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_WINBOND_QSPI1 

1 bit read from Winbond Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_ISSI_QSPI4 

4 bit (Quad) read from ISSI Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_ISSI_QSPI1 

1 bit read from ISSI Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_SPANSION_QSPI4 

4 bit (Quad) read from Spansion Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_SPANSION_QSPI1 

1 bit read from Spansion Flash

DEVICE_TYPE_CUSTOM 

Custom Flash Mode

enum qspi_ReadCommand_e

Enumerates the values used to represent QSPI commands.

Enumerator
QSPI_CMD_READ_24 

Read command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_READ 

Normal Read command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_RDSR 

Command to Read Status Register-1

QSPI_CMD_RDSR2 

Command to Read Status Register-2

QSPI_CMD_RDCR 

Command to Read Configuration Register-1

QSPI_CMD_WREN 

Write enable command

QSPI_CMD_WRREG 

Write register command

QSPI_CMD_WRITE_24 

Write command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_WRITE 

Normal write command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FAST_READ_24 

Fast read command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FAST_READ 

Fast read command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FAST_DREAD_24 

Fast dual read command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FAST_DREAD 

Fast dual read command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FAST_QREAD_24 

Fast quad read command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FAST_QREAD 

Fast quad read command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_MFGID 

Read manufacturer Id command

QSPI_CMD_BLKERASE_24 

Block Erase(64 kB or 256 kB) command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_BLKERASE 

Block Erase(64 kB or 256 kB) command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_PAGEERASE 

4 kB Sector Erase command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_PAGEERASE_24 

4 kB Sector Erase command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_FULLERASE 

Full Flash Erase command

QSPI_CMD_SPANSION_RESET 

Spansion Flash: Software Reset command

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_READ_24 

Micron Flash: Read command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_RDSR 

Micron Flash: Command to Read Status Register-1

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_QREAD_24 

Micron Flash: Fast quad read command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_WRITE_24 

Micron Flash: Write command for 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_MFGID 

Micron Flash: Read manufacturer Id command

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_WREN 

Micron Flash: Write enable command

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_BLKERASE_24 

Micron Flash: Block Erase(64 kB or 256 kB) command for 3 or 4 Byte Address

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_FULLERASE 

Micron Flash: Full Flash Erase command

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_RDNVCR 

Micron Flash: Command to Read Non Volatile Configuration Register

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_WRNVCR 

Micron Flash: Command to Write Non Volatile Configuration Register

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_RDEVCR 

Micron Flash: Command to Read Enhanced Volatile Configuration Register

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_WREVCR 

Micron Flash: Command to Write Enhanced Volatile Configuration Register

QSPI_CMD_MICRON_1GBIT_FULLERASE 

Micron 1G Bit Flash: Full Flash Erase command

QSPI_CMD_WINBOND_RDSR2 

Winbond Flash: Command to Read Status Register-2

QSPI_CMD_WINBOND_WRSR2 

Winbond Flash: Command to Write Status Register-2

QSPI_CMD_RESET_ENABLE 

Reset Enable command

QSPI_CMD_RESET_DEVICE 

Reset Memory command

QSPI_CMD_JDEC_DEVICE_ID 

Command to detect flash Device Id

enum qspiCfgModeTxCmd

Enumerates the various transfer commands to be set in the command register for transfer using configuration registers.

Enumerator
QSPI_CFG_MODE_TX_CMD_FOUR_PIN_READ_SINGLE 

Four Pin single read command .

QSPI_CFG_MODE_TX_CMD_FOUR_PIN_WRITE_SINGLE 

Four pin single write command .

QSPI_CFG_MODE_TX_CMD_FOUR_PIN_READ_DUAL 

Four pin dual read command.

QSPI_CFG_MODE_TX_CMD_THREE_PIN_READ_SINGLE 

Three pin single read command.

QSPI_CFG_MODE_TX_CMD_THREE_PIN_WRITE_SINGLE 

Three pin single write command.

QSPI_CFG_MODE_TX_CMD_SIX_PIN_READ_QUAD 

Six pin quad read command.

enum qspiChipSelect

Enumerates the different chip selects available to QSPI. QSPI module have four chip selects to connect to four external devices.

Enumerator
QSPI_CHIP_SELECT_CS0 

Chip select 0

QSPI_CHIP_SELECT_CS1 

Chip select 1

QSPI_CHIP_SELECT_CS2 

Chip select 2

QSPI_CHIP_SELECT_CS0 

Chip select 0

QSPI_CHIP_SELECT_CS1 

Chip select 1

QSPI_CHIP_SELECT_CS2 

Chip select 2

enum qspiClkMode

Enumerates the four possible clock modes for QSPI. Each mode has different values of clock phase(CKPH) and clock polarity(CKP)

Enumerator
QSPI_CLK_MODE_0 

Mode 0 - Clock polarity = 0, clock phase = 0

QSPI_CLK_MODE_1 

Mode 1 - clock polarity = 0, clock phase = 1

QSPI_CLK_MODE_2 

Mode 2 - clock polarity = 1, clock phase = 0

QSPI_CLK_MODE_3 

Mode 3 - clock polarity = 1, clock phase = 1

QSPI_CLK_MODE_0 

Mode 0 - Clock polarity = 0, clock phase = 0

QSPI_CLK_MODE_1 

Mode 1 - clock polarity = 0, clock phase = 1

QSPI_CLK_MODE_2 

Mode 2 - clock polarity = 1, clock phase = 0

QSPI_CLK_MODE_3 

Mode 3 - clock polarity = 1, clock phase = 1

enum qspiCsPol

/brief Enumerates the polarities for different chip select available. (Chip Select 0 to Chip Select 3)

Enumerator
QSPI_CS_POL_ACTIVE_LOW 

Chip select polarity active low

QSPI_CS_POL_ACTIVE_HIGH 

Chip select polarity active high

enum qspiDataDelay

Enumerates the value of Data delay value for each chip select. Data is output on the same cycle as CS_N goes active, or 1, 2 or 3 DCLK cycles after the CS_N goes active depending on the data delay provided.

Enumerator
QSPI_DATA_DELAY_0 

Data is output on the same cycle as the CS N goes active.

QSPI_DATA_DELAY_1 

Data is output 1 DCLK cycle after the CS N goes active.

QSPI_DATA_DELAY_2 

Data is output 2 DCLK cycle after the CS N goes active.

QSPI_DATA_DELAY_3 

Data is output 3 DCLK cycle after the CS N goes active.

enum qspiIntrMask

This enumerates the flags for word or frame interrupt for QSPI module.

Enumerator
QSPI_INTR_MASK_MODE_M_FAIL 

Interrupt mask for mode fail interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_UNDERFLOW_DET 

Interrupt mask for underflow detected interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_IND_OP_DONE 

Interrupt mask for complete last triggered indirect operation interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_IND_RD_REJECT 

Interrupt mask for indirect op request rejected interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_PROT_WR_ATTEMPT 

Interrupt mask for write to protected area rejected interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_ILLEGAL_ACCESS_DET 

Interrupt mask for illegal AHB access detected interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_IND_XFER_LVL_BREACH 

Interrupt mask for indirect transfer watermark level breached interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_RECV_OVERFLOW_DET 

Interrupt mask for receive overflow interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_TX_FIFO_NOT_FULL 

Interrupt mask for small TX FIFO not full interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_TX_FIFO_FULL 

Interrupt mask for small TX FIFO full interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_RX_FIFO_NOT_EMPTY 

Interrupt mask for small RX FIFO not empty interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_RX_FIFO_FULL 

Interrupt mask for small RX FIFO full interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_IND_RD_SRAM_FULL 

Interrupt mask for indirect read partion of sram full interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_POLL_EXP_INT 

Interrupt mask for max num of programmed polls cycles expired interrupt

QSPI_INTR_MASK_IRQ_STAT_RESV 

Interrupt mask for reserved interrupts

QSPI_INTR_MASK_FRAME 

Interrupt mask for frame interrupt.

QSPI_INTR_MASK_WORD 

Interrupt mask for word interrupt .

enum qspiMemMapNumAddrBytes

Enumerates the number of Address bytes to be sent before transfer in memory mapped mode for each chip select.

Enumerator
QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_ONE 

One address byte for Chip Select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_TWO 

Two address bytes for chip select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_THREE 

Three address bytes for chip select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_FOUR 

Four address bytes for Chip select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_ONE 

One address byte for Chip Select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_TWO 

Two address bytes for chip select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_THREE 

Three address bytes for chip select N

QSPI_MEM_MAP_NUM_ADDR_BYTES_FOUR 

Four address bytes for Chip select N

enum qspiMemMapPortSel

This enumerates the values for switch to be set in the QSPI switch register for selection between config port and memory mapped port. If 0 (default) config port has is selected to control config of core SPI module module. If 1, Memory Mapped Protocol Translator is selected to control config port of core SPI module.

Enumerator
QSPI_MEM_MAP_PORT_SEL_MEM_MAP_PORT 

< config port is selected to control config of core SPI module.

enum qspiMemMapReadType

This enum Enumerates the different read types for each chip select for transfer in memory mapped mode.

Enumerator
QSPI_MEM_MAP_READ_TYPE_NORMAL 

Normal read type for Chip select 0 Normal means single read mode.

QSPI_MEM_MAP_READ_TYPE_DUAL 

Dual read type for chip select 0

QSPI_MEM_MAP_READ_TYPE_NORMAL_READTYPE 

Normal read type for Chip select 0

QSPI_MEM_MAP_READ_TYPE_QUAD 

Quad read type for chip select 1

Function Documentation

void QSPIconfigIdleMode ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
uint32_t  idleMode 
)

This function configures the idle mode of the QSPI.

Parameters
baseAddQSPI base address.
idleModeIdle mode to be configured. Possible values are 0x0: Force-idle. An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally 0x1: No-idle. An idle request is never acknowledged 0x2: Smart-idle. Acknowledgement to an idle request is given based on the internal activity of the module
Returns
None

void QSPISetClkMode ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  clkMode 
)

This function configures the QSPI to work in different clock modes for each output chip select.

The combination of Clock phase and clock polarity creates the SPI mode. Most serial flash devices support only mode 0 and mode 3. Changing the clock polarity also swaps the transmit/receive clock edge relationship. If a slave device states that it receives data on the rising edge and transmits on the falling edge of the clock, then it can only support mode 0 or 3. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

The 4 possible modes are :

CKP CKPH Description 0 0 Data input captured on rising edge of qspi1_sclk clock. Data output generated on falling edge of qspi1_sclk clock 0 1 Data input captured on falling edge of qspi1_sclk clock. Data output generate on rising edge of qspi1_sclk clock 1 0 Data input captured on falling edge of qspi1_sclk clock. Data output generated on rising edge of qspi1_sclk clock 1 1 Data input captured on rising edge of qspi1_sclk clock. Data output generated on falling edge of qspi1_sclk clock

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of QSPI module registers.
chipSelectchipSelect for which the mode is to be configured. Supported values according to enum qspiChipSelect_t.
clkModeMode required to be selected. Supported values given by enum qspiClkMode_t
void QSPISetClockControl ( uint32_t  baseAdd,
qspi_ClockFreq_e  in_ClockSettings 
)

This function sets DCLK_DIV feild in SPICC register and enables clock.

Parameters
baseAddQSPI base address.
in_ClockSettingsClock Settings based on enum qspi_ClockFreq_e.
Returns
None

void QSPISetMemAddrSpace ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  memMappedPortSwitch 
)

Set Memory address space.

This function selects the memory mapped mode in SPI switch register and configures mapped address for different chip select in control module. It provides a functionality for remapping the memory mapped address space to one of the four supported chip selects or to the configuration registers.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers
memMappedPortSwitchSwitch for selection of memory mapped port and configuration port. Supported values are given by enum qspiMemMapPortSel_t.
chipSelectchip select for which polarity is to be configured. Supported values given by qspiChipSelect_t.
void QSPISetMemMapNumAddrBytes ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  numAddrBytes 
)

Set number of address bytes for memory mapped mode.

This function configures the number af Address Bytes to be sent for memory mapped protocol translator for selected chip select.By default, the device uses 3 address bytes. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers.
chipSelectchip select for which polarity is to be configured. Supported values are according to enum qspiChipSelect_t.
numAddrBytesNumber of Address bytes to be sent for memory mapped protocol translator. Supported values are : for each chip select given by enum qspiMemMapNumAddrBytes_t.
void QSPISetMemMapNumDummyBits ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  numDummyBits 
)

Set Number of dummy bits for memory mapped mode.

This function configures the number of Dummy Bits to be sent for memory mapped protocol translator for selected chip select for fast read mode. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers.
chipSelectchip select for which polarity is to be configured. Supported values are according to enum qspiChipSelect_t.
numDummyBitsNumber of Dummy Bits to be sent for memory mapped protocol translator. User can pass any value from 0 to 32 bits.
void QSPISetMemMapReadCmd ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  readCmd 
)

Set Read Command in memory mapped mode.

This function configures the read command for memory mapped protocol translator in memory mapped SPI setup register. The command send is according to the slave device connected. By default, the device uses a read command of 0x3. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers.
chipSelectchip select for which polarity is to be configured. Supported values are according to enum qspiChipSelect_t.
readCmdRead Command to be sent to the flash device. This command is specific to the flash device being used.
void QSPISetMemMapReadType ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  readType 
)

Set read type in memory mapped mode.

This function configures the read type for QSPI in memory mapped mode for selected chip select.Determines if the read command is a single, dual or quad read mode. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers.
chipSelectchip select for which polarity is to be configured. Supported values are according to enum qspiChipSelect_t.
readTypeRead type to be chosen. Supported values are given by enum qspiMemMapReadType_t.
void QSPISetMemMapWriteCmd ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  chipSelect,
uint32_t  writeCmd 
)

Set write command in memory mapped mode.

This function configures the write command for memory mapped protocol translator in memory mapped SPI setup register. The command send is according to the slave device connected. By default, the device uses a write command of 0x2. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers.
chipSelectchip select for which polarity is to be configured. Supported values are according to enum qspiChipSelect_t.
writeCmdWrite Command to be sent to the flash device. This command is specific to the flash device being used.

Returns

void QSPISetPreScaler ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  clkDividerVal 
)

Set the QSPI clock register divider value.

This function sets the QSPI clock control register with serial data clock divider ratio (DCLK_DIV) according to the input clock provided and the output clock required. DCLK_DIV = ((input clock) / (output clock)) - 1. This function also enables the clock for QSPI module. This can only be done if QSPI module is not busy.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address for QSPI module registers.
clkDividerValclock divider value to be set.

This function is blocking and waits till busy bit in status register is reset.

Parameters
baseAddQSPI base address.
Returns
None
